result.execSummary:
The defendant Wayne Anthony Scroggins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Wayne Anthony Scroggins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Wayne Anthony Scroggins was found guilty of Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Wayne Anthony Scroggins was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of community service.
Department has authority to order no contact with S.W. if they deem it appropriate.
Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:31 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF1120, 13CF162, 12CM2371, AND 12CF810. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn. 
VRCW. 

PLEA HEARING IN 15CF1120.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Strangulation and Suffocation/DA/Repeater/DA Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
Ct. 4 (Battery/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>DISMISS. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 2 (Battery/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 3 (DC/DA/DA Repeater/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING IN 15CF1120 and SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 13CF162, 12CM2371, AND 12CF810. 
S.W. makes statement. Def makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF1120: Cts. 2 & 3>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES. 
In 13CF162: Ct. 1>>5 years imprisonment - 3 years IC and 2 years ES. 
In 12CM2371: Ct. 1>>9 months MCJ. 
In 12CF810: Ct. 2>>9 months MCJ. 
                    : Ct. 3>>90 days MCJ. 
                    : Ct. 5>>9 months MCJ. 

COURT finds the def entitled to: 
In 15CF1120: 86 days sentence credit. 
In 13CF162: 717 days sentence credit. 
In 12CM2371: 307 days sentence credit. 
In 12CF810: 337 days sentence credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES>>assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS; the dept has the authority to order no contact with S.W. if they deem it appropriate; DNA sample and surcharge in 15CF1120; any outstanding costs/fees from 13CF162, 12CM2371, and 12CF810; CC including 2 DA surcharges in 15CF1120. 

COURT ORDERS all sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 

COURT finds the def is NOT eligible for CIP or SAP. 

COURT remands def into custody for transport to WSPS. 

Adj: 4:00 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
and Defense Motions in Limine (sent to Judge)

No contact with victim(s): S.W. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol.     Shall not consume alcohol.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:03 pm 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.

ARRAIGNMENT. 
Information previously filed. Reading waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty.  

FPT. 
State notes deft is on probation hold at this time. 
State requests bond modification to signature bond and requests adjournment of jury trial. 
Atty Bohn notes deft does NOT take position re: bond modification. 
COURT ORDERS $1000 signature bond with same conditions. 
COURT leaves jury trial on the calendar at this time with understanding it could be adjourned if ADA Puerner's other trial goes. 

Adj: 1:07 pm
Preliminary Hearing on 1/8/2016 before Judge Falstad
